intro: Solanum marsilianum, commonly known as the Marsilian nightshade, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and Asia. It is a herbaceous shrub that typically grows to a height of about 1 to 2 meters. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by red, fleshy berries that are toxic to humans and animals. Its leaves are simple, ovate, and have a rough texture, while its stems are hairy and often reddish in color. Solanum marsilianum is part of the nightshade family (Solanaceae), which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and potatoes.
